framework_intro.para: 写书评时，建议采用以下结构。将书评要点和内容填写到相应位置。

step.label: 书评或影评的目的是什么？

commentary.para: 书评的主要目的是向潜在读者提供信息，以便他们决定是否想读这本书。影评的目的亦相同，可按书评的模式写影评。
以下是本书评所采用的结构。
构思书评时，须确定各段的内容并列出要点。
提问题是吸引读者的一种方式。
作者接着提出自己的看法。
此处写作品的名称和作者姓名。
同时提供背景和时代信息。
用现在时讲述故事很常见。
加入写作风格方面的信息会有帮助。
可重申自己的看法，表明是否推荐阅读这本书。
衔接词有助于篇章组织连贯。

checklist.point: 阅读或重读这本书，并就书的情节、人物、写作风格和自己的看法做笔记。
设想一下读者可能问的问题。
做好笔记之后，参照本结构的套路确定自己想以何种顺序呈现信息和组织要点。
用适当的词语描述情节和人物。
找出一系列用于介绍书、情节和人物的形容词。
在词典中查找 book 或 story 等詞的同义词。
按本结构组织好要点之后，照此结构写书评。
记着书评读者没有读过这本书。
最好对书的优点和缺点均加以评论。

content.para: A review of Wuthering Heights by Emily Brontë

paragraph.name: 引言
paragraph.tip: 提示：提问题是吸引读者的一种方式。亦可先提出自己的看法。此处应写作品的名称和作者姓名。背景和时代信息也很有用。

notes.para: Love story or gothic story? Blend of both. Written in 1847. Family saga. Main characters: Catherine and Heathcliff. Violent emotions: desire, hate, revenge, regret. Wild Yorkshire moors reflect this.

content.para: Is it a darkly passionate tale of love? Or should we call it a highly original gothic story? The classic novel 'Wuthering Heights' by Emily Brontë is, in my opinion, a unique and gripping blend of these genres. Written in 1847, it is an epicfamily saga full of desire, hate, revenge and regret, focusing on the main characters of Heathcliff and Catherine. The atmospheric setting of the wild Yorkshire moors cleverly mirrors these violent emotions.

paragraph.name: 情节
paragraph.tip: 提示：用现在时讲述故事很常见。书评每部分可分几段写。

notes.para: Story: Catherine's father adopts Heathcliff. Her brother, Hindley, is jealous. She falls in love with Heathcliff. Father dies and Hindley makes Heathcliff be a servant. Catherine marries Edgar Linton - closer in class and position in society. Leads to tragedy.

content.para: When Catherine's father adopts the starving orphan boy Heathcliff, Catherine's brother Hindley feels deeply hurt and resentful. She, on the other hand, develops an immensely strong bond with Heathcliff, which becomes an all-consuming love. Upon her father's death, Hindley becomes the head of the family and forces Heathcliff to assume the position of a servant. Despite loving Heathcliff, Catherine chooses to marry Edgar Linton, who is closer to her class and position in society. It is this decision which leads to heartbreak and tragedy, not only for them but for many others.

paragraph.name: 人物
paragraph.desc: 简要描述和评论主要人物。

notes.para: Heathcliff: anti-hero - rough manners, lack of control. Catherine has flaws. Readers empathize with them both. Book brilliant because true: readers horrified by behaviour of Catherine and Heathcliff but don't hate them because the reasons for their actions are clear.

content.para: Heathcliff could be described as an anti-hero with his rough manners and lack of control. Likewise, Catherine displays many flaws but the reader can still empathize with these characters. In fact, this is the main reason why I believe this novel is so brilliant. It rings with truth. The reader may be horrified at the way that Heathcliff and Catherine behave, and yet, at the same time, the writer ensures we never hate them because the reasons for their actions are crystal clear.

paragraph.name: 其他信息
paragraph.desc: 你想说的关于这本书的其他要点（如写作风格、文学手法等）。

notes.para: Book has narrator - Ellen Dean, a servant. Useful because holds the plot together. Book is not an easy read: dense description; dialogue in dialect - can be difficult to understand.

content.para: The main part of the book relies on a narrator, Ellen Dean, who is a servant at Wuthering Heights and I think that this is a useful device which holds the complex plot together. However, Wuthering Heights is not what I would call an 'easy read'. There is dense description and some of the dialogue is written in dialect, which can be difficult to follow.

paragraph.name: 总结
paragraph.tip: 提示：可重申自己的看法，表明是否推荐阅读这本书。

content.para: Nevertheless, I persevered and, all in all, can highly recommend Wuthering Heights. I challenge you to remain unmoved after reading this exceptional book.
